subject: Hockey, Ice
lead_paragraph: Todd Bertuzzi, best remembered for an on-ice attack from behind on Colorado’s Steve Moore in 2004, signed a contract with the Calgary Flames. Bertuzzi, 33, scored 14 goals and had 26 assists with the Anaheim Ducks last season but was released so the Ducks could re-sign the restricted free agent Corey Perry. Bertuzzi had signed a two-year, $8 million deal with Anaheim last summer. A two-time All-Star, Bertuzzi’s best season was in 2002-3, when he scored a career-high 46 goals with the Vancouver Canucks.
